page.title: 05Residents' Views
page.content: Scotland Road and Great Homer St. were regarded as the heart of L'pool. Many residents remember terraced housing and a close-knit community before dual carriageway, the new tunnel deveopment and high-rise blocks changed the area. A resident told us: {"The people knew they didn't want { those}(skyscrapers){up. They went to { Kirkby,Southdene & Skelmersdale.They { wanted to go together but it didn't { work out that way. Families were { split up.Now they're all scattered." Another said, dramatically: {"Uncle George couldn't believe what { had happened here when he came back. { He was 79 and cried in the street." Many spoke of a different atmosphere: {"The neighbours were friends. They { would help you if you were sick. You { could leave your door on the latch. { Now people lock themselves in."
